question: In which year, the "Battle of the Metaxas Line" was fought?
explanation: The Battle of the Metaxas Line, also known in Greece as the Battle of the Forts, fought between 6â€“9 April 1941, was the first battle during the German invasion of Greece in World War II. The Germans succeeded in capturing several individual forts but failed to breach the fortified Metaxas Line in general. The capture of Thessaloniki forced the Greek East Macedonia Army Section to surrender on the 10th of April and the Metaxas Line battle was over.
